dns_records.address: record of where domain resolves to. IP, domain name, or 'NXDOMAIN'
dns_records.first: firstseen date formatted in a way dateutil.parser can parse
dns_records.record_type: Kind of DNS record. E.g. any of the following: ['A', 'AAAA', 'NS', 'CNAME', 'SOA', 'MX', 'TXT', 'PTR', 'DNAME']

URL.hostname: domain of URL (the bit between the http:// and the TLD)
URL.ip: IP the URL is hosted on if available
URL.filetype: e.g. file/js, file/html, etc.. Uses one-hot label encoder trained on all OTX data so unseen labels are okay, will be parsed as null values if unseen.
URL.fileclass: The encoding used for the file hosted at the URL if applicable. E.g. 'ELF', 'BAT', 'HTML'. Again, uses label encoder and will return null if unseen
URL.http_code: Response code given by URL when accessed. E.g. 200, 404, etc.. Formatted as a string
URL.encoding: Encoding used for website body. E.g. utf-8, html, gzip. Uses pretrained one-hot label encoder.
URL.server: Header on server. Usually formatted [ServerSoftware]/[version] ([OS]) [[Service]/[Version], ...]. E.g. 'Microsoft-IIS/8.5', 'Apache/2.4.10 (Win32) OpenSSL/1.0.1i PHP/5.6.3', 'Apache Phusion_Passenger/4.0.10 mod_bwlimited/1.4'
URL.expiration: When the URL (domain name?) expires. Formatted as a date dateutil.parse can understand

IP.country_code: 2 or 3 character string denoting IP host country. E.g. USA, RU, UK
IP.asn: combination of asn number, and issuing body separated by a space. E.g. 'ASN0001 ip provider llc'

resolves_to.host: record of where domain resolves to. IP, domain name, or 'NXDOMAIN'
resolves_to.first: firstseen date formatted in a way dateutil.parser can parse
resolves_to.record_type: Kind of DNS record. E.g. any of the following: ['A', 'AAAA', 'NS', 'CNAME', 'SOA', 'MX', 'TXT', 'PTR', 'DNAME']
